name: Wireshark
description: A free and open-source packet analyzer used for network troubleshooting, analysis, software and communications protocol development, and education.

name: Apackets.com
description: An online tool for packet analysis that allows users to capture, analyze, and visualize network traffic in real-time.

name: Arkime
description: An open-source, large-scale, and high-performance network traffic analysis tool that captures, indexes, and stores network traffic for offline analysis.

name: Nmap
description: A free and open-source network exploration and security auditing tool that allows users to discover hosts and services on a computer network, thus creating a map of the network.

name: Network Miner
description: A free and open-source network forensic analysis tool that captures packets and extracts files from network traffic.

name: Masscan
description: A free and open-source TCP port scanner that can scan the entire Internet in under six minutes.

name: Nipe
description: A free and open-source tool for redirecting all Internet traffic from the machine to the Tor network.

name: Monit
description: A free and open-source tool for managing and monitoring Unix systems, including network and system services, files, directories, and devices.

name: Zeek
description: An open-source network security monitoring tool that captures network traffic and generates logs that can be used for network analysis, troubleshooting, and security investigations.

name: Netcat
description: A free and open-source networking utility for reading from and writing to network connections using TCP or UDP protocols.

name: Aircrack-ng
description: A free and open-source network security tool for assessing Wi-Fi network security. It can be used for cracking WEP and WPA keys, sniffing network traffic, and conducting MITM attacks.

name: Zmap
description: A free and open-source network scanner that can rapidly scan the entire IPv4 address space for open ports and services.
